book.title: Rackspace Cloud Load Balancers Release Notes

abstract.para: This document is intended for software developers interested in developing applications using the Rackspace Cloud Load Balancers Application Program Interface (API).

revdescription.para: Updated for v1.19.13 (SYD and IAD only) .
This is the initial release of this document.

chapter.title: Document Change History
chapter.para: This version of the Release Notes replaces and obsoletes all previous versions. The most recent changes are described in the table below:

listitem.para: Added additional field currentConn to stats call for better connection tracking.
Implemented private cluster ability.
Updated stats call to properly track SSL virtual servers.
Fixed a bug where modifying certain attributes of a load balancer with HTTPS Redirect enabled could cause an ERROR state.
Fixed HostEndpointPoller Failure due to stats updates.
Updated HTTPS Redirect virtual servers to use the "discard" pool instead of creating an extra empty pool.
Fixed the Management Sync call to recreate load balancers in the correct sequence when both SSL Termination and HTTPS Redirect are enabled.
Changed the Management Sync call to keep the load balancer in PENDING_UPDATE status for the duration of the sync.
Fixed issue where deleting error pages caused load balancer to go into an ERROR state if SSL termination was subsequently enabled.
Fixed concurrency issue where deleting nodes on a load balancer would not always be honored.
Fixed issue where updating the connection throttle was causing load balancers created prior to the 1.19.32 release to go into an ERROR state.
Various improvements to backend services.
Includes updating wsdls to prepare for supporting Stingray 9.5 in an upcoming release.
Updated primary key column on certain database tables from 32-bit to 64-bit.
Fixed issue where SSL usage was bleeding over onto non-SSL usage records.

Added support for HTTPS redirection feature. Refer to the description for the httpsRedirect attribute at http://docs.rackspace.com/loadbalancers/api/v1.0/clb-devguide/content/Create_Load_Balancer-d1e1635.html and http://docs.rackspace.com/loadbalancers/api/v1.0/clb-devguide/content/Update_Load_Balancer_Attributes-d1e1812.html for details.
Nodes are no longer a required attribute for creating a new load balancer, and it is now possible to delete or disable a load balancer's last remaining node.
Enhanced request/response logging for ATOM Hopper integration.
Bug fix to ensure correct bandwidth usage.
Expiration validation of SSL certificates now in place.
Improved usage gathering mechanism.
This includes:
Using SNMP instead of SOAP to gather usage metrics.
Gathering of usage from failover nodes.
Gathering of usage from all hosts a load balancer has served traffic on.
Fixed various bugs related to old usage implementation.
Improved public API accessibility of usage from a 2 hour delay to a 1 hour delay.

note.para: This release is for the SYD and IAD datacenters only. This will be released for the other datacenters later.

listitem.para: Expiration validation of SSL certificates now in place.
Improved usage gathering mechanism.
This includes:
Using SNMP instead of SOAP to gather usage metrics.
Gathering of usage from failover nodes.
Gathering of usage from all hosts a load balancer has served traffic on.
Fixed various bugs related to old usage implementation.
Improved public API accessibility of usage from a 2 hour delay to a 1 hour delay.
Provided a packaged tool to allow for processing logs separately if needed.
Fixed a race condition that was causing some very large logs to get corrupted for customers.
Fixed the SOAP API endpoint so that the SOAP calls are sent to the correct node.
Upgraded Stingray Traffic Manager (STM) to version 9.2 for ORD and LON datacenters.
Updated log messages to provide details after Management API sync call is completed.
Modified logging process to use updated Hortonworks Hadoop cluster for customer logs.
Atom Hopper support for SYD
Dropped Duplicate Indexes and added additional logic to resolve duplicate usage entries.
Updated datacenter regions to support SYD (Sydney).
Fixed issues with Atom Hopper processing.
More tracking on the entries as well as alerts and service events are generated for better tracking and monitoring.
Updated AHUSL (Atom Hopper Usage Service Layer) to handle referenceId for corrected usage.
Added configuration ahusl_logs_fail_requests to print all AHUSL entries.
Added referenceId value/behavior for corrected usage records.
Added configuration ahusl_logs_requests to print all AHUSL (Atom Hopper Usage Service Layer) entries.
Updated logs app ArchiveLogsJobs, which is now run in its own cron interval. Added configuration job.repeat.archive.interval to hadoop-logs.conf for this.

When deleting a health monitor of any type, every node on that load balancer that is enabled or has failed and is in OFFLINE status is now returned to the ONLINE status regardless of the health of the node.
Logs are now uploaded to the correct datacenter based on the environmental region. This eliminates the billing issues for files.
Usage was still not being tracked correctly for ServiceNet load balancers, causing users to incur incorrect charges, so this resolves the issue.
D-11222: Updating service_event 'Data too long' issue. Allowing for proper deletion after ptr deletion.
Added Repose integration. This allows the load balancer service to use a scalable service to maintain authentication and rate limits.
Update XML parsing to verify potential DTD exploits.
Usage was not being tracked correctly for ServiceNet load balancers, causing users to incur incorrect charges.

B-27058: Added Half-Closed support on the load balancer. Refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/loadbalancers/api/v1.0/clb-devguide/content/Create_Load_Balancer-d1e1635.html and http://docs.rackspace.com/loadbalancers/api/v1.0/clb-devguide/content/Update_Load_Balancer_Attributes-d1e1812.html for details.

D-10314: Timeout was previously not being mapped until the user set its value. This has been fixed so a default timeout value is now mapped and displayed in the response if the user has not set the value. Refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/loadbalancers/api/v1.0/clb-devguide/content/Create_Load_Balancer-d1e1635.html for details about timeout.
Updated USL entry with resourceName attribute for BRM.
Support can no longer 'sync' a suspended load balancer.
Updated removal of load balancers more than 90 days old to properly handle no SSL Termination. This will reduce the amount of logs that OPS has to sift through.
Added HTTP request logging format change to include the node that was used for the connection.
B-35550: Added Health Monitoring based logging with ATOM and API formatted feeds. Refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/loadbalancers/api/v1.0/clb-devguide/content/Node-Events-d1e264.html for details.
B-34716: Added timeout option to load balancer. Refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/loadbalancers/api/v1.0/clb-devguide/content/Create_Load_Balancer-d1e1635.html for details.
Updated Shared IPs information with samples for IPv4/IPv6 combinations. Refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/loadbalancers/api/v1.0/clb-devguide/content/Create_Load_Balancer-d1e1635.html for details.
B-34873: Added additional management call for listing account load balancers that retrieves extended data for load balancers on an account including virtual IPs.
Updated PTR record management for load balancer CRUD operations.
Ability to share UDP and TCP based protocols on the same port.
D-08841: Fixed error that caused a DB constraint when cleaning up the DB for expired load balancers from cron and ones that had either SSLTermination Records or UserPages.
Fixed error handling and logging to verify and properly handle the cases for suspension/deletion and timing of usage records.
D-07704: Fixed bug where updating load balancer attributes with SSL Termination failed with 500 error code.
Fixed usage bug where the poller failed to update tags properly if and when the poller went down.
Ability to set hostHeader when creating an HTTP and HTTPS health monitor.
USL integration. For more information, refer to: https://wiki.mosso.com/display/cseng/LBaaS+AHUSL+Integration+Information.
Fixed bug where changing the condition of a node to anything except enabled on the last node threw an error, but still changed the status in the database.
Fixed bug where reassigning hosts was not working in the management API.
Fixed bug where cron job that deleted load balancers was failing due to user pages.
Content caching feature for HTTP load balancers.
Ability to assign metadata to nodes.
Usage enhancements for grabbing correct usage during events including suspended load balancers.
Fixed bug where updating the weight on the only enabled load was causing load balancer to go into error state.
Fixed bug where shadow virtual server now gets the correct custom error file.
Fixed bug where health monitoring was not working for IPV6 nodes.
Fixed bug where default error page was not being assigned correctly after deleting custom error page.
Fixed bug that allowed the port of an existing load balancer to be updated to the same port that SSL was terminated on.
Modified usage calls to account for SSL termination.
Added SFTP protocol.
Added support for Source IP session persistence for non-HTTP load balancers.
Added cluster status to the management API call to get clusters.
Added management report to return all states for a load balancer.
Fixed bug where updating protocol of a load balancer with IPV6 was returning a 500.
Fixed bug so that adding host returns host id.
Modified logic for picking the correct Zeus host for making SOAP API end point calls.
Fixed bug where the management API call to get events by username was not accepting a date range.
Fixed bug where SSL usage was being ignored in the batch delete of load balancers.
Users can specify primary and secondary nodes for their load balancers.
Added new protocols such as TCP Client First, DNS, UDP, and MySQL.
Valid, allowed, Rackspace-based domain names can be used to add nodes.
Metadata can be assigned to each load balancer.
List Load Balancers call now displays the node count.
Added public API call List Allowed Domains so users can see the list of allowed domains.
Added public API call List Billable Load Balancers to list an account's billable load balancers for a date range.
Added management API calls for adding and retrieving allowed domains.
Added management API call Retrieve Account-Specific Usage to retrieve account-specific usage for all accounts for the given date range. The response is paginated.
Added management API call Retrieve Load Balancer-Specific Usage to retrieve load balancer-specific usage for all load balancers for the given date range. The response is paginated.
Use actual time as directory/file name for Hadoop logs in cloud files.
Deleted old Hadoop states from the state table.
Fixed bug to allow sharing of IPV6 VIPs when creating a load balancer.
Fixed bug so that the same blacklist item/record cannot be added multiple times.
Fixed bug to return correct response when adding an absolute limit that already exists.
Fixed bug to update rate limit on the shadow virtual server.
Deleting error page now returns a 202.
Moved rate limiting functionality out of the application to Zeus load balancer.
Added additional logging to figure out why Zeus is not deleting traffic ip group, and does not throw an exception.
Fixed bug to accept SSL keys in a format other than just asn1.
Fixed bug to add X-Forwarded-Proto header to all HTTP loadbalancers.
Fixed bug to add X-Forwarded-Proto header to HTTP loadbalancers that have SSL enabled.
SSL traffic can now be terminated at the load balancer layer.
An absolute limit could not be updated or deleted via the management API.
GET alerts were being allowed by cluster.
Accounts billing usage was allowing invalid date ranges.
A host can now be added using the management API.
Load balancers with shared VIP's will be created on the same host as the original load balancer, regardless of cluster status.
Logging bug related to missing 'usage_timezone_code=insert_timezone_code_here' in the config file.
Fixed bug where load balancer with connection logging enabled was going into error state when updating protocol to HTTP.
Fixed bug where batch delete of access lists was not correctly deleting access list from database.
Some load balancers in ORD experience error status when being created or updated.
View real time statistics for load balancers
Upgraded to Auth 1.1 for authentication
A default IPV6 is being provisioned when creating a load balancer. (This was turned off in Release 1.6.13 as a temporary mitigation strategy.)
Fixed issue where the management API calls were failing Basic HTTP Authentication
Fixed bug where a node condition was not being changed correctly from draining to enable
Some load balancers in ORD experience error status when being created or updated.
Custom Error page for offline load balancer nodes
Node query parameter nodeaddress added for use with the List Load Balancers API call to find out if any load balancer for an account has a specific node attached to it
Disabled and discontinued passive health monitoring for new load balancers
Optimized ZXTM Adapter
Fixed issue with scheduled jobs marker as query parameter not working
Fixed duplicate IPV6 node bug
Fixed issue causing failure when deleting a load balancer using a shared virtual IP
Some load balancers in ORD experience error status when being created or updated.

note.para: ORD Zeus configuration and failover issues cause load balancers to go into error status when being created or updated; waiting on patch from Zeus.

listitem.para: B-05341: Custom Error page for offline load balance nodes
B-07122: Disable passive health monitoring for new load balancers
D-01588: Scheduled Jobs - marker as query parameter does nothing
D-01615: Duplicate IPV6 node bug
D-01887: Change object for looking for a node with address on load balancers
B-08528: Optimize ZXTM Adapter
D-01942: Delete load balancer fails when using shared VIPs
Resolved a bug causing billing issues for newly provisioned load balancers
Some load balancers in ORD experience error status when being created or updated.
TCP Protocol Support
Source IP address displayed in load balancer details
X-Forwarded-For header added to all HTTP load balancers
Ability to delete multiple access list, virtual IPs, load balancers, and nodes
Fixed bug causing load balancers to remain in a "pending delete" status after being deleted
Fixed bug causing "invalid load balancer" statuses to return a 500 Internal Server
Fixed bug preventing logs from working for UK load balancers
Fixed bug preventing deleted nodes response from returning a consistent 202
When creating or updating a load balancer, if a user attempts to select "TCP" from the protocol drop-down list in the Control Panel, the action will fail.
As a workaround for the previous issue, the user can select "Custom" from the protocol drop-down list in the Control Panel, and specify a port value between 1-65535.
Fixed bug that required bodyRegex for HTTP/HTTPS health monitors

chapter.title: v1.5.7, June 29, 2011
chapter.para: This version is a maintenance release only.

listitem.para: Load balancer goes into error state when rapidly adding additional IPV6 to a load balancer.
IPv6 support
Ability to add extra IPv6 virtual IP addresses to a load balancer
Fixed issue that allowed HTTPS load balancers to check for HTTPS monitors
Fixed issue that caused two health monitors to be created on the same load balancer
